speaker: Niles
text: You sure Daphne will like this one?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's perfect, Niles.  Look, it even says on the box, "for the perfect DVD viewing experience."

speaker: Niles
text: [_reading_] What do you suppose "multi-angle capability" means?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_know-it-all_] Well, it means that the remote control will respond from any angle.

speaker: Claire
text: Not to intrude, but actually it means you can see a scene from different camera angles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I-I was just, uh, teasing him.  You see, my brother's technologically challenged.

speaker: Claire
text: If you're, uh, new to DVD, you might want to rent the director's cut of "_Das Boot._ "  It's amazing - I mean, if you don't mind subtitles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mind them?  I prefer them!  In fact, I-I do speak a-a bit of German, so in this case they might actually be a distraction!

speaker: Claire
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.

speaker: Claire
text: I speak German too.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, if anyone's technologically challenged, it's you.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's a bit defensive. Nimm ihn einfach ncht zur Kenntnis. [_Just ignore him._]

speaker: Claire
text: [_responds in German; they laugh_]

speaker: Niles
text: You thought your CD-ROM drive was a cup holder.  [_N.B. Marvin Falz of Germany sent The Frasier Archives a note about this particular dialogue. Frasier says "Nimm ihn einfach ncht zur Kenntnis" which means "Just ignore him". Claire's response sounds like gibberish to me except for the "Ja Ja" ("Yes yes"). The way she pronounces "Ja Ja" and the way her face looks while saying it, she's actually saying something along the line of "whatever you say, I don't take you seriously, I ignore what you're saying and my answer is condescending just to shut you up".  Also Frasier doesn't seem to know that in Germany at this point of a relation and in this situation he wouldn't say "Nimm ihn einfach nicht zur Kenntnis" but "Nehmen Sie ihn einfach nicht zur Kenntnis". The difference is the social situation. The formal you (Sie) maintains some kind of distance between persons so it's usually used when adults are talking business for example in a shop or in the workplace. Adults who are familiar with one another and have agreed on using the familiar you (du or Du at the beginning of the sentence) would say "Nimm ihn einfach nicht zur Kenntnis". The same applies for adults talking to children and adolescents under the age of 18. Parents and their children usually talk to one another using the familiar you. Children and adolescents also use the familiar you when they're among themselves. In public schools for example children and adolescents address adults using the formal you unless the adults allow a familiar you. So they would say "Nehmen Sie ihn einfach nicht zur Kenntnis."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks a lot!  I was interested in her.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, how was I supposed to know?

speaker: Frasier
text: I was speaking German!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes - the language of love! Perhaps he has learned since then, or that earlier episode was simply inconsistent -- since it is virtually required that any serious student of Freud should read him in the original German._]  Behind Niles, Frasier sees Lana Gardner come into the store. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, it's Lana, it's Lana.

speaker: Niles
text: [_excited_] Where, where?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, no, no, just turn around, turn around!  I don't know why the woman frightens me.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, she should frighten you, she was prom queen!

speaker: Lana
text: Hi!  Sorry, it took me forever to find a parking spot. [_Claire hands Lana the shopping bag she's carrying_] Thanks. [_sees Frasier_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Lana!  Uh, look Niles, it's Lana.

speaker: Niles
text: [_giggling like a teenager_] Hi, Lana.

speaker: Lana
text: Hi!  Oh, this is my friend, Claire French.  Frasier Crane, his brother Niles - we've known each other since high school.  [_N.B. Clare (no "i") French is the name of a producer's assistant on "Frasier."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we've already met.  Uh, _guten tag_ , Claire.

speaker: Claire
text: I knew I'd recognized your voice.  You're on the radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, well, I'm flattered that you've listened.

speaker: Lana
text: You should have seen him in high school.  Do you remember when you petitioned the school to have interpretive dance added to gym class? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, is that a CD organizer?  I'll be right back! [_moves off_]

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, I need one of those myself, excuse me.

speaker: Lana
text: So Niles, how's things?

speaker: Niles
text: Things are good.

speaker: Lana
text: Are you married now?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I was, but, uh, I'm not now. [_cocksure_] But I'm goin' with someone.

speaker: Clerk
text: Next!

speaker: Lana
text: Oh yes, I need to return this. [_takes a portable stereo from the bag and puts it on the counter_]

speaker: Clerk
text: Oh, it's scratched.

speaker: Lana
text: Well, it was like that when I bought it. _Anyone who's seen "Big Crane on Campus" can tell where this is going. Over to Frasier and Claire, looking at CD organizers:_

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm not much of a faux walnut grain enthusiast.

speaker: Claire
text: Uh, Frasier, I-I wanted to ask you something.  Saturday night, are you free?

speaker: Frasier
text: Only with a coupon. [_they laugh_] What did you have in mind?

speaker: Claire
text: Well, a bunch of us are throwing a surprise party for Lana, I was wondering if you could bring her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm not sure I'm the right person for this.  You see, last year Lana and I dated for a brief period, and, uh, well, things just didn't work out.  Don't get me wrong, it's not that she isn't a lovely person-

speaker: Clerk
text: Next.

speaker: Lana
text: I don't give a rat's ass about your policy!  Get me the manager!

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps you could ask someone else.

speaker: Claire
text: Come on, just ask her out as a friend.  Once you're there, you can leave... [_with unmistakable suggestiveness_] Or stay.

speaker: Lana
text: Are you calling me a liar?! [_to the whole store_] DON'T BUY ANYTHING HERE, THE SERVICE SUCKS! _She smiles sweetly at Niles, who is beginning to understand his brother's fear._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it is her birthday. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Martin, wearing his glasses, has the DVD player on his lap. Niles stands next to him._

speaker: Martin
text: Red wire, red wire, where do you go?  Oh, here we are.

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, maybe the red wire's extra.  Niles, hand me that yellow one, will you?

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne punched me in her sleep last night.  Honestly, she is the most aggressive sleeper I have ever known.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow.  You being a psychiatrist, you probably think she's acting out some form of repressed hostility towards you, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: That was the furthest thing from my mind... until now.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry about it.  Sounds to me like you guys are still finding your sleeping groove.

speaker: Niles
text: Sleeping groove?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  First six months your mother and I were together, we were like Dempsey and Tunney! [_then_] You see, Dempsey and Tunney were-

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Dad, please, I know a little something about vaudeville.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've got our movie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, knock it off! [_punches his arm lightly_] I told you I was sorry.

speaker: Niles
text: [_rubbing his arm_] It's all right. [_sees_] "Who Framed Roger Rabbit?"

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, it's got everything - action, romance, and humor. I mean, who's funnier than Roger Rabbit?

speaker: Niles
text: No one?

speaker: Daphne
text: Exactly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm off to pick up Lana.

speaker: Niles
text: You're oddly chipper about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course I am, Niles.  The sooner I deliver her to the surprise party, the sooner I can cast my net of romance over a butterfly named Claire.  You know, I've got a good feeling about this one.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh Frasier, you always have a good feeling.  You think it's going to be perfect, and then when she turns out not to be the Kierkergard-reading, souffle-baking, haiku-writing cellist, you're disappointed.  You have to learn to settle.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_looks at him_] What does that mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Have fun, Niles.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hi!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Where are you going?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, just to a little party.

speaker: Roz
text: Have a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, everybody.  Am I too late?

speaker: Martin
text: No, you're perfect.  We're all hooked up and ready to go.

speaker: Roz
text: Great.  I brought "Caddyshack"!  Who's funnier than that gopher?

speaker: Daphne
text: Roger Rabbit, that's who-

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, what about my movie, "The Longest Day"?  It's got D-Day and the Duke!

speaker: Niles
text: Whoa, that is an embarrassment of riches.  Each movie more appealing than the last.  Well, perhaps there's a happy compromise in "The Unbearable Lightness of Being." [_holds it up_]

speaker: Roz
text: Well that would be a happy compromise, except for one thing: Boring!

speaker: Daphne
text: I think we should use the manual.

speaker: Martin
text: I don't need a manual!  I need a pair of wire strippers, a hammer, and a beer. [_goes to the kitchen_]

speaker: Niles
text: All right, well, while he's doing that I just have to pose the question: who's funnier than Daniel Day-Lewis? _Daphne and Roz look at him.  FADE TO:_ **WHAT WOMEN MAY OR MAY NOT WANT** _Scene Three - Frasier's BMW Frasier is driving Lana._

speaker: Frasier
text: You look lovely tonight.

speaker: Lana
text: Thank you, you look nice too.

speaker: Lana
text: Look, I'm gonna be real direct.  We're just two good friends going out for dinner, OK?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Lana
text: I only say that because you went a little heavy on the cologne, and I don't want you to have any expectations.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have nothing of the sort.  And by the way, it's scented soap.

speaker: Lana
text: I mean, I only accepted because it really sounded like you could really use a night out.  I don't want some awkward scene where you try to get in my pants.

speaker: Frasier
text: I assure you, there will be no such scene.

speaker: Lana
text: Good. [_pause_] Unless of course I have too much to drink, [_slightly manic laughter_] and I change my mind!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, how are those kids of yours doing?

speaker: Lana
text: Oh, my youngest is good, he's in the ninth grade.  But Kirby, if he doesn't pass U.S. history he's not going to graduate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, have you considered getting a tutor?

speaker: Lana
text: That's a good idea.  You used to do that sort of thing in high school, didn't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, yes, yes, I-I did.  And I-I would do it for Kirby in a heartbeat.  It's just that I'm asked a lot, and if I helped him I'd have to do it for everyone, and I'd hate to open those floodgates.  You understand.

speaker: Lana
text: Yeah.  I mean, my ex is the one I should be asking, but that would be a waste of time.

speaker: Frasier
text: He doesn't help out with the kids?

speaker: Lana
text: No, the only kid he has time for is Kathy, his 22-year old receptionist.  It's sickening.  Mind if I smoke?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually-

speaker: Lana
text: I'll just crack a window.

speaker: Lana
text: You know, I'm glad you asked me out tonight.  Tomorrow is my birthday!

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Oh, happy birthday.

speaker: Lana
text: Hardly.  That's the day Bob and Kathy have chosen to get married - in Tahiti!  Some birthday. _As she gazes mournfully out the window, Frasier picks up a small can of air freshener and sprays._

speaker: Lana
text: All right.  That's good, tonight'll get my mind off of it. Just promise me that I won't even hear the word "birthday" for the rest of the night, OK?

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?  I mean, maybe a big celebration would be the best revenge.

speaker: Lana
text: [_almost crying_] What am I celebrating?  The fact that I'm becoming an old trot and no one's ever going to love me again? Oh God, shut up! [_stubs out her cigarette_]

speaker: Lana
text: Aren't we going to Bella Lucia?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually I-I know this little Thai place that I think will be better.

speaker: Lana
text: Well, were you even going to ask me?  I hate Thai food! Typical man, "I like Thai food, so she must like Thai food."

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Bella Lucia it is.

speaker: Lana
text: I'm sorry, I'm-I'm being snappy.  It's just... I-I guess I just always thought that I'd be the one who got remarried first, you know?  Now everybody's just going to feel sorry for me.  Oh God, I hope I don't run into anybody I know tonight! [_Frasier is worried_] And you're not a typical man. You're very thoughtful.  Forgive me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I'm afraid I do.  Oh gosh - you know, I-I do know another little Italian place that I think you might really enjoy just as much - well, what do you say?

speaker: Lana
text: Great, sounds great.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK.

speaker: Lana
text: You know, it's funny, as much as I hate the thought of my birthday, I'm kind of hurt that none of my friends asked me to do anything.  I mean, not like I wanted a party, but, well, something would have been nice.

speaker: Lana
text: OK, OK, Frasier, you know what, just because I'm vulnerable doesn't mean you're getting some!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  Listen: fifty of your friends are sitting in Bella Lucia right now, wearing party hats and waiting to yell, "Surprise!" Do you want to go or not?

speaker: Lana
text: [_happy_] My friends are throwing me a surprise party?!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right.

speaker: Lana
text: [_Carrie_] And you tell me and ruin it?! _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four - Bella Lucia Claire and the rest of Lana's friends are waiting when Lana walks in._

speaker: All
text: SURPRISE!

speaker: Lana
text: [_feigned_] Oh my god, you didn't! [_to Claire_] You, you did this!

speaker: Lana
text: Frasier, you tricked me, you awful thing! [_shoves him playfully_]

speaker: Frasier
text: It wasn't easy, you nightmarish carp! _He gives her a not-too-gentle shove back, and heads for the bar. Claire puts a tiara with "Happy Birthday" on it on Lana's head, and gives her a drink._

speaker: Lana
text: Thank you - Debbie, oh hi!  Bruce, hi!  I am so thrilled you all came here for this!  I thought a lot of you would have flown to Tahiti for the wedding of Dumbo and Bimbo!

speaker: Claire
text: Thanks for getting her here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Claire
text: How did you manage to keep it a secret?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, as a psychiatrist, discretion happens to be the cornerstone of my profession.

speaker: Claire
text: Ah, of course.  Mine too - I'm a family therapist.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  You know, I-I sensed we have a lot in common.

speaker: Claire
text: You know, it's funny how things turn out.  I started out as a music major, studying the cello.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're a cellist?

speaker: Claire
text: Yes, but psychology is my true calling. "Spawning fish that leave upstream for many seasons, yet come home to stay."

speaker: Frasier
text: Was that a haiku?

speaker: Claire
text: Yes.  It's, uh, it's a habit of mine.  They just sort of spill out of me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's amazing! [_loosens his collar_] Uh, may I get you a drink?

speaker: Claire
text: Yes.  Uh, a martini - two olives.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  I knew it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Kierkergard?

speaker: Claire
text: Love him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't move.

speaker: Lana
text: Claire!  What are you doing staring at the moon?  I want you to meet Neil, the guy I told you about. _Frasier turns back from the bar with two martinis - and sees Claire talking with Lana and a handsome man in an expensive suit.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Apartment Martin and the gang are still sat around the living room.  Roz reads a magazine, Daphne looks through the manual for the DVD player while Martin fumbles with the cables._

speaker: Martin
text: All right, what's it say now?

speaker: Daphne
text: "Alternatively, see Appendix C: Advanced Troubleshooting Specifications and You."

speaker: Martin
text: That's it, I quit. [_throws cables up in the air_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what do you want to do?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I went to a party once where we each went around the room and confessed our most shameful secret - except it had to be something that you've never told anyone before.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't think that's something we really want to get into.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, sounds like fun.

speaker: Niles
text: OK, I'll go first.  Oh, let's see - all right, well, Daphne, you might as well make your acquaintance with my dark side. In fifth grade, there was a bully, Jack Winfield, who was bothering a lot of the girls, so one day I waited for him outside of school and gave him a sound thumping.

speaker: Martin
text: Wasn't that the kid with rickets?

speaker: Niles
text: Rickets and a smart mouth.

speaker: Roz
text: Daphne, you go next, and think of something juicier than that.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, well, um, mine's also a youthful indiscretion.  I stole a teddy bear from the shops.

speaker: Roz
text: Then what?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I felt guilty, so I told my parents and we brought it back.  Then as a penance, I... volunteered to work at the orphanage after school.

speaker: Roz
text: What the hell was that?!  I'd put that story on my resume! Come on, Martin, you've got to have something!  Shock me!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I don't know, it's kind of personal.

speaker: Roz
text: That's what we're looking for.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, all right, but it doesn't leave this room: every time I watch "The Sound of Music"... I cry.  And I don't mean a single manly tear.  I mean real blubbering, girl-style. The nuns... those kids... that lonely goatherd.

speaker: Roz
text: These are your deep, dark secrets?  This is baby stuff! "Ooh, I dropped my ice cream and I ate it!"

speaker: Daphne
text: OK, let's hear yours, then.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you can't handle mine.  Let's play "Clue" or something.

speaker: Martin
text: Are you kidding?  We can take anything you could dish out! I was in the war, I was a cop, I even worked Vice!

speaker: Roz
text: I don't think so.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, come on, I'll tell you what: whisper it in my ear, and if I think they can handle it I'll tell them.

speaker: Roz
text: OK. _She cups a hand to his ear and whispers.  As she does, his smile disappears, and his face goes from shock to outright horror. She finishes.  He stumbles out of his chair, not even looking at Niles and Daphne, and hurries to his room, stopping only to cast one more horror-stricken glance at Roz, who triumphantly tosses her hair back.  FADE TO:_ **TUESDAYS WITH FRASIER** _Scene Six - Bella Lucia Lana, half in her cups, is sitting at a table with three nervous guests (the only ones left)._

speaker: Lana
text: [_mournful_] Where was Kathy while I was busting my ass putting him through dental school?  Oh, oh, that's right - she wasn't BORN YET!

speaker: Guest 1
text: Who wants more cake?

speaker: Guest 1
text: Not me, but I'll go with you! _They get up and leave the table.  At the bar, Claire is wedged between Neil and Frasier.  She is holding a glass of red wine, but Frasier hands her another._

speaker: Frasier
text: Here we are.  This is one of my favorites.

speaker: Claire
text: That's so sweet of you, but Neil just brought me a glass.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this one.  Yes, that's a delightful little wine, yes, it's very nice.  But this happens to be a Bavaresco Diam, the greatest Italian red since Roberto Rossellini! [_laughs_] _With both men watching her like hawks, she uncomfortably sips one, noises "Mmm," to the gratification of Neil, and then the other, also with an "Mmm," to Frasier's delight._

speaker: Claire
text: Well, they both taste wonderful.  I-I don't, I can't choose between them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Taste mine again.

speaker: Neil
text: You know, if you're really interested in wine, Claire, you should let me fly you down to Napa in my plane.  We could spend the day exploring vineyards.

speaker: Claire
text: Oh, that's very sweet, but those little planes make me nervous.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how do you feel about, uh, BMW's?  You see, I-I happen to know several of the proprietors of the local vineyards here, and I'd be delighted to be your tour guide. _At the other side, all the guests have now left, and Lana is alone at her table._

speaker: Claire
text: That sounds tempting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, allow me to enchant you further.  You see, I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Claire, I'm sorry, uh, you'll have to excuse me for just a moment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.  How you doing?

speaker: Lana
text: Everybody's leaving.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's getting late.

speaker: Lana
text: It's 9:30!  Let's face it, I drove them all off.  Even I'm sick of hearing me complain about Bob.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, come on, it's not all that bad.  I mean, listen, you know, Bob is in the past.  I mean, just look at all the friends you have.  I know you've had a bit of a tough time lately, but it'll end soon.  You're a vibrant, attractive woman.

speaker: Lana
text: Thanks, Frasier.  You're being awfully sweet to me.  Don't think this means you're getting any.

speaker: Neil
text: We're, uh, saying our goodbyes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're leaving?

speaker: Claire
text: Uh, I have an early appointment and Neil offered to give me a ride home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how thoughtful of him.

speaker: Claire
text: Happy birthday, Lana. [_they hug_] It's nice to see you again, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely seeing you again, Claire.  Neil... _They shake hands, Neil with a small, triumphant smile.  They leave and Frasier sits back down._

speaker: Lana
text: Threw a gutter ball, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks to you, you introduced them.

speaker: Lana
text: Well, you played it all wrong!  You were hanging on her all night!

speaker: Frasier
text: So was he, but he left with her.

speaker: Lana
text: It won't last.  She's probably sick of him already.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lot of good that does me.  I blew it.

speaker: Lana
text: Not necessarily.  I mean, I think you guys could make a great couple.  In fact, I might be able to help you out there.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Would you?

speaker: Lana
text: Well, I _could_ , but you know I get asked that all the time, and if I did it for you, then I'd have to do it for everybody, and I just don't know if I want to open those floodgates! You know what I mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think I do.

speaker: Lana
text: Kirby needs a passing grade in history.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't guarantee that.

speaker: Lana
text: No passing grade, no Claire.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, an hour on Tuesdays.

speaker: Lana
text: Two hours on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

speaker: Frasier
text: Two hours on Tuesdays, no Thursdays.

speaker: Lana
text: Three on Tuesdays.

speaker: Frasier
text: Done, happy birthday.

speaker: Lana
text: Thank you. _They shake hands.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Lana's House Frasier is sitting at Lana's kitchen table with her son Kirby - a staring teenager with a punk hairstyle and a "chicks dig scram pale guys" t-shirt.  Lana is cooking at the stove._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you're a very lucky young man, Kirby.  You know, I loved studying U.S. history.  What could be more fascinating than the rich and unfolding epic of the very soil on which we live?

speaker: Kirby
text: Uh, will that question be on the test?

speaker: Frasier
text: Doubtful. [_opens textbook_] So, which chapter are you on?

speaker: Kirby
text: Whoa, is that my book?

speaker: Frasier
text: I see - Chapter 1. [_begins reading, then_] You may want to take some notes.

speaker: Kirby
text: I don't have a pen.  But just tell me, I'll remember it.

speaker: Lana
text: Oh yeah, yeah, that's gotten you far. [_they look at her_] GET OFF YOUR ASS AND GET A PEN!!! _This sends both Kirby and Frasier jumping to their feet.  Kirby scrambles out of the kitchen, and Frasier goes to follow him-_

speaker: Lana
text: No, not you, not you, not you!
